summary: The diff removes any visible Caffeine AI attribution from the footer, but it also appears to substantially redesign/replace the footer content and add new footer behavior that was not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Footer content and structure were significantly changed beyond just deleting the Caffeine AI attribution line (new branding/icon, new sections like Quick Links and Important Notice, new smooth-scroll click handler).
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-1 required deleting only the "Built with â€¦ using caffeine.ai" line while keeping the rest of the footer content intact; REQ-2 required only removing now-unused code related to that attribution. The diff shows a full footer implementation with additional sections and behavior not mentioned in the BuildRequest.

hallucinated_features.description: Project metadata/state files were updated (feature request entries/status), which was not requested as part of the UI watermark removal.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest is specifically about removing a footer attribution line and cleaning unused frontend code; it does not request updating project tracking files.
